Aurigny is recruiting - Direct Entry Captains on the ATR72-600 Minimum Requirements: Total Time = minimum 2,000 hrs. Multi-crew operations = minimum 500 hrs on a type greater than 10t MTOW and greater than 19 seats. Minimum PIC time = 500 hrs on a type greater than 10t MTOW and greater than 19 seats. UK CAA ATPL licence, UK CAA Class 1 medical and English level 5 or greater. ATR72-600 type rating preferred but type ratings and difference courses provided as required. Please email your CV to Careers@Aurigny.com Based in Guernsey you may be offered relocation support, a work permit to access the local market on-island property market, and join a small team who are PROUD to fly for the Islanders' Airline. Competitive salary and benefits. Part time and/or contract positions considered.

Aurigny Air Services is Hiring a Technical Services Engineer! üõ¨ Are you passionate about aviation and eager to ensure the reliability and compliance of aircraft? Aurigny Air Services is seeking a dedicated Technical Services Engineer to join our team in Guernsey. This full-time role is essential in supporting our fleet and maintaining high standards of safety and performance. Essential Skills: Degree in Aircraft/Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent, or Part 66 license. Desirable Skills: Previous experience in a similar role. Well-organised with attention to detail. Proactive with the ability to work on own initiative and meet deadlines. Strong problem-solving skills. Requirements: Regulatory training (Part M (Part CAMO), Part 145, SMS) and mandatory training (Human Factors, EWIS, ETOPS, FTS) will be provided. Join a team that values respect, integrity, and excellence. If you are ready to take on this exciting role, we would love to hear from you. Please apply by visiting our Careers page on our website or by following this link: https://lnkd.in/eMmV2GB3 For more information please contact careers@aurigny.com Be part of a team that is proud of you, proud of our airline!

Aurigny Air Services is hiring a Head of Human Resources Location: Guernsey, Channel Islands The Role As the Head of Human Resources, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the HR strategy and managing the HR operations for our airline. You will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, and compliance. Your goal will be to foster a positive and productive work environment that supports our company‚Äôs objectives and promotes employee satisfaction and retention. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy. Oversee the recruitment and selection process to attract top talent and ensure a smooth onboarding experience. Manage employee relations issues, providing guidance and support to managers and employees. Develop and implement performance management systems to drive employee engagement and productivity. Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations in the UK and the Channel Islands. Lead HR projects and initiatives to support business growth and operational efficiency. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and teamwork. Provide leadership and guidance to the HR team, ensuring effective delivery of HR services. Your profile: Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field. A master's degree or HR certification (CIPD) is preferred. Proven experience as a HR leader, preferably within the aviation or transportation industry. Working knowledge of UK and Channel Islands employment laws and regulations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build effective relationships at all levels of the organization. Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing HR strategies that drive business success. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex employee relations issues. Ability to lead and motivate a team, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment. High level of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality. How to apply Please send your resume and a cover letter to HRrole@aurigny.com

Join Aurigny as a Business Intelligence Analyst and set about providing actionable insights through data-driven decision-making. Who We Are: At Aurigny we're not just about planes, we're about experiences. We're a dynamic team driven by innovation, creativity, and the relentless pursuit of excellence. With a commitment to quality and a customer-centric approach, we're redefining our customer experience and leaving a lasting impact. What You'll Do: You have a passion for numbers and understand how to query data. You will utilise your experience of storytelling through data visualisation to communicate key business metrics and findings, empowering stakeholders to make informed decisions about performance across a range of functions within the airline. Your role will involve seeking out anomalies and patterns in business data, finding insights that bolster strategies and identify priorities. Responsibilities include creating and delivering analysis reports to executive management, ensuring the accuracy of reporting, and contributing to the preparation of monthly performance reporting. Join us and be at the forefront of shaping Aurigny's success through shining a light on performance, mining data for simple and complex questions and providing a source of truth that underpin actionable data insights Ready to Take the Lead? If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make your mark, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team as Business Intelligence Analyst and embark on an exciting journey of growth, challenge and opportunity. Please email careers@aurigny.com for more information. Closing date: 17th May 2024 Aurigny is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Join Aurigny as a Revenue Management Analyst to drive revenue optimisation and flight performance. Who We Are: At Aurigny we're not just about planes, we're about experiences. We're a dynamic team driven by innovation, creativity, and the relentless pursuit of excellence. With a commitment to quality and a customer-centric approach, we're redefining our customer experience and leaving a lasting impact. What You'll Do: You love the insights you find in numbers and your role will include daily analysis of booking data to maximise flight and ancillary performance. You'll explore the optimal settings for demand forecasting and seasonality within our fare structure and draw on insights from our revenue management system. By evaluating route performance and competitor activity, you'll present strategic recommendations that drive stronger unit revenue performance. Your expertise will be pivotal in monitoring market performance and forecasting, adjusting pricing and inventory positions. Collaboration with the broader Commercial team is key as well as advanced Excel capabilities. Join us and be at the leading edge of Aurigny's success in the aviation industry. Ready to Take the Lead? If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make your mark, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team as Revenue Management Analyst and embark on an exciting journey of growth, challenge and opportunity. Please email careers@aurigny.com for more information. Closing date: 17th May 2024 Aurigny is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
